alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 6:59PM CDT until July 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Greenwood County in southeastern Kansas... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 657 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles south of Hamilton to 7 miles north of Eureka, moving south to southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Eureka, Hamilton, Climax, Virgil, Eureka City Lake, Fall River Lake, Eureka Airport, Thrall and Fall River State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Toronto and Fall River Lake...get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
